Reviews.Title: “Better than expected ...”
Reviews.Author: PeeJay51
Reviews.Content: ... having read reviews here before we left. It is not a luxurious hotel but it is clean and the staff couldn't be more helpful. I went with a friend. We were doing a short Mexican tour. 3 nights were booked at this hotel. Yes, it is in the gay area of Zona Rosa and, as a couple of women on our own, we did not feel at all vulnerable. The Police station is right next door to the hotel so there is quite a heavy police presence in this area, although not obtrusively so to make you question your safety. The area taken care of, now to the hotel. Not a very large lobby but welcoming on arrival after an 11 hour flight from the UK. Check in was quick and easy. Room was spacious and clean. The surprise was when we sat on the beds and found out how hard they were! Expecting a poor night's sleep because of that we were more than surprised to find out that they were actually quite comfortable and we did get a good night's sleep. Because of our hectic schedule we made a conscious decision to eat in the hotel and found the food of extremely good quality and a reasonable price if compared with what we'd pay at home. May be expensive by Mexican standards but certainly not by UK standards and neither were the in-house drinks. We used room service a couple of times and also the restaurant. The waiting staff, particularly the head waiter, were very helpful and attentive and we certainly couldn't have asked for better. There was a good breakfast selection. The only problem I had was .... tea! I just couldn't get a decent cup of tea so gave up trying in the end. On our check out morning we had a major problem with a transfer we were expecting and the reception and back office staff went out of their way to help. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff we had contact with and would certainly recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to stay in Mexico City. The only thing that would help would be a few more lifts. There are only 2 for the large number of floors, hence rooms. During the day, not a problem but in the mornings, when so many people are checking out and others wanting the lifts to go to breakfast, it can be quite a wait to get one with space in, especially as each lift only has an 8 person capacity. I can't really comment on value for money on the room tariff as the hotel was booked as part of a package deal here in the UK and the package included another 2 hotels as well as the tour itself. We certainly didn't feel we'd been overcharged on the whole package once our holiday came to an end.

Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel in heart of Zona Rosa”
Reviews.Author: mooshimom
Reviews.Content: Hotel Geneve on Avenida Londres is a beautiful old hotel-spectacular lobby full of interesting memorabilia and displays. Great service-most helpful concierge and staff in general. Our room is spacious, beautiful dark spanish style furniture, marble bathroom, lovely linens, floor to ceiling windows with handsome draperies. WIFI. Ask for interior room if you want quiet. Very reasonable price - under $100 per nite including taxes. Close to metro and lots of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “no great charm, clean, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: josieWashingtonDc
Reviews.Content: Room is fairly large, everything is adequate, not bad, not great. Just blah. Great view from the 16th floor. The staff is very friendly. We were with a group and the hotel organized a special dinner for us which was ok with drinks at outrageous prices.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible staff, average location and ok rooms for the price”
Reviews.Author: Juanmanuelrosis
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the bar area called the zona rosa (mostly gay bars) it is kind of central close to the center of the city. The staff of the hotel was terrible, they don't know anything about service quality and client satisfaction. Maybe the only nice ones were the baggage guys. The rooms were ok, but we had to change rooms because our a/c broke. I dont recommend this hotel and will never return to this "royal" crap.

Reviews.Title: “Good, safe, comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: DrPJCR
Reviews.Content: I'd stayed in this hotel at least a dozen times, during 5 years. It is a well located place, in the middle of Zona Rosa, a nice place in Mexico city. It has a lot of restaurants and shops nearby, and also it has the police station like 20 steps away, so there are at least 4 or 5 cop cars outside the hotel. It has a 4 diamond restaurant called tezca on the corner, but you never watch people in it. The rooms are clean and comfortable, the staff is really helpful. You have free internet on all the hotel, and sometimes, depending of your reservation you can get free breakfast. The restaurant is really simple, but rather good. On the mornings, they serve all kinds of bread, eggs, beans, chilaquiles, pancakes, waffles, yogurt, fruit. One of the biggest secrets in this hotel is outside. They have one of the best tourist taxi drivers in all of Mexico, Mr. Carlos Cuellar. He can take you almost everywhere, he's really helpful. This man really improve our visits to Mexico. Something you have to consider if you visit this area, Zona Rosa is Mexico's most open neighborhood for sexual diversity, so a lot of people will be surprised with some of the â€œscenesâ€œ you find during the night. They also have a big parking lot inside the hotel, and a free gym. They also have a pool on the rooftop, but it is really small, and it is always cold. Overall this is a great hotel, not too fancy, but not too cheap either.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to city , subway, attractions. But A/C broke down and they treated us like we were a bother to them.”
Reviews.Author: SilvioGH
Reviews.Content: Perfect location if you are gay or just accepting of them. Very safe area and convenient to the rest of city. Many places to see at night and only about 1 mile from the Angel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Zona Rosa and lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: caz1205
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just a couple of nights as part of a group tour. The rooms were spacious, modern and clean, and the beds were really comfortable. The hotel staff were very helpful, especially Luis the concierge. The rooftop pool area is a bit small (as is the pool) and there never seemed to be anyone up there! Probably just as well, as there are only 4 sun loungers! But it was a nice area to sit and have a cold beer. Everything is within walking distance, only a few minutes to shopping malls, bars and restaurants. Great breakfast, including some hot Mexican options and also the usual fruit, cereal, toast, rolls, croissants, ham, cheese, juices and tea or coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families with kids”
Reviews.Author: FanIAm
Reviews.Content: Also known as the Best Western Zona Rosa, this Hotel Royal turned out to be the perfect place for a family with kids. It's in a great neighborhood with lots of eateries and shops around--reminded me a bit of Greenwich Village--and is even in walking distance of Chapultepec Park, if you don't a leisurely stroll. Best of all it has a pool on the roof which is heated to nearly hot tub temperatures, as well as small grass yard, a manned bar, and really nice views all around the city from the 17th floor. Rooms are nothing special but they're completely functional with AC, TV, two queen beds and a pull-out twin sofa bed. So the five of us were able to fit in to one room. Perhaps even more best of all they were running a summer special of pay for 2 nights, get the 3rd free so our total bill, with a glass of wine on the roof, was $234 for three nights. Not too bad for a decent hotel with heated pool in a great neighborhood. Be sure to try Biwon, a Korean BBQ place around the corner--great theater for the kids--and the Cupcakeria which just got written up in a big travel magazine. Everything's right in the neighborhood, including lots of cheap, delicious breakfast spots--like Tacontento. Huge breakfast tortas and other Mexican specialties for around 35 pesos. Skip all the hotel restaurants as, like always, they are very overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not great.”
Reviews.Author: 1norcalman
Reviews.Content: We were in Mexico City for a week vacation and booked The Best Western Royal Zona Hotel on a competing website. The price was excellent and the reviews seemed favorable. Overall, it is an OK place to stay. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean, and the WiFi is really fast and dependable. The neighborhood is very eclectic with everything from excellent restaurants and shopping a few block away, so seedy sex shops just down the street. That being said, there is also a police station a half a block away, and police are constantly on the street. Even at night, we felt very safe walking for dinner or shopping. Still, this is not a Marriott or Intercontinental. It's a Best Western and a bit of an older one at that. It is in need of a make-over. The beds and pillows are perhaps the most uncomfortable I've ever encountered in a hotel (and I travel extensively throughout Mexico so I know what hard beds are ... these are really the worst). The air conditioning never worked properly, and since the windows don't open, the room was always warm and stuffy. Though on a side street, it is quite noisy with horns honking and traffic (perhaps because there is a gap between the window frame and the building that lets all the noise come in), the carpets are stained and need replacement, and while some days towels were soft and fluffy, other days they were thread bare. If you can find a bargain rate and stay here for $50 a night, it's probably worth it. But anything more than that, I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel for couples ok if u r a backpacker”
Reviews.Author: swansrock
Reviews.Content: Staff were extremely rude, when we were not happy with our room and asked if we could possibly pay to upgrade they offered us a $160USD upgrade to the penthouse suite as that is the only better room they had. There was no was were paying a total of $260USD for a night in a best western so after no further help checked out after 1 night which was meant to be a 4 night stay. Not a great area if you want to see the sights of Mexico City it is more a party-bar atmosphere. The beds were as hard as rocks and the pillows may as well not have been on the bed they were so soft. Would never recommend to anyone to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, quality and service”
Reviews.Author: Mada2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed there one night in march on my way to Cancun and Playa del Carmen so I can not write much. Most important information are: great location good base for city tour, hotel and rooms clean and nice, bathrooms too. Breakfast tasty and various dishes available. Staff friendly and very helpfull. PH is really really nice. Big terrace at the top of the building wih small swimming pool. I did not found anything negative about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great value, good location”
Reviews.Author: gfxetal
Reviews.Content: upscale but not pretentious, very clean, efficient. rooftop bar and heated pool are great for relaxing after a day of sightseeing or business. room temperature was a little cool and didn't respond to heat controls but everything worked (plumbing, lights, tv, etc), good quality linens. comfortable place for a traveler to unwind.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, central, clean, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: LindaAyleenGermany
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel. We had a great view over the city and the neighbourhood is very nice as well. The rooms are spacious, well equiped and the beds are very comfortable with a hard matress. We would definately recommend this hotel and have no complains at all! The breakfast was good as well with eggs, yoghurt, toast, fresh fruit, coffee, juice, beans, avanas etc.

Reviews.Title: “Some room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: CesarioLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: This is a reasonably priced hotel in the middle of the Zona Rosa. Location is good, with lots of shops, restaurants etc nearby. Don't expect luxury or extras with this hotel, but the basics were there. No complaints with the room service. What needs some training and work is the front desk. They have good intentions, but are not as professional and do not always have the attention to detail that most international travelers expect from a hotel in the DF. In my case, they made mistakes such as checking me out by mistake during the middle of my stay. Also, my keycard kept failing for some reason. These little things unnerved me during my stay, which is a pity since , like I said, they wanted me to have a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “A HORRIBLE HOLIDAY WHICH I THOUGHT I WOULD GO TO RELAX”
Reviews.Author: yahoohere
Reviews.Content: this hotel was was marvelous at FIRST but i do have a few crititsisoms when we got to the hotel room the bed sheets had not been changed and the smell i their was apourling other than that it was fine. I also have to say i found cockroaches in the bath tub and a turd in the 'outstanding' pool my mother couldnt catch her breath so called vacation to relax, i sertainly wont be goin back and i would not advise anyone else to !

Reviews.Title: “Expense vs Value ration is poor”
Reviews.Author: sbmvr
Reviews.Content: My tour operator has selected this hotel and I was not too happy about it. The hotel is located in a clubby area, with the partying going on nearby all night. Very significant police presence make one more reassured that nothing would happen. The electronic key did not work every single time I needed to opem my door, so I develpped a phobia of doors. Every time had to take the elevator back to the lobby to have it reset. The reception staff is not too professional and are overwhelmed and dont care much. Breakfast was reasobable, better than some other similar hotels in Mexico City. Overall, the service was poor and location would not be my first choice. There are other hotels, that are better quality and cheaper in better areas. And the Business Center, with the Internet enabled PCs is closed on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing, would not return”
Reviews.Author: EDIEBr
Reviews.Content: Disinterested staff, poor to rude service, mosquito problem, limited and poor TV reception, completely ineffective "air conditioning" - location itself is not enough to stay here, there are better choices in the Zona Rosa

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nice location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: wildsunshine
Reviews.Content: I'd have rated excellent but photos look actually prettier. It was sad we were not able to try Tezka restaurant cause it was under remodeling

Reviews.Title: “Great location but rock hard beds!”
Reviews.Author: monkeyherder
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in lots of moderately priced hotels in big cities and the number one thing we look for is... location! This hotel is a great base camp if you plan on spending most of your time exploring the city. It's a 2 minute walk to the metro stop "Insurgentes" on the pink line and almost anything you might want to do in the city can be accessed via the metro. However, Mexico City is HUGE so things seem closer than they really are. There are mediocre restaurants in the hotel, but with several Sanborns and Vips neaby, there's really no reason to eat in the hotel even if you're not adventurous enough to look for other more authentic places to eat. It's a short walk to the Independence Angel and strolling along the Paseo de la Reforma is a nice way to digest dinner. There's a good indoor market nearby that opens at 10 am for picking up souvenirs and other crafts. And just as an FYI, you are right down the street from a bunch of gay bars, so the area is very lively at night and there's lots of PDA around. If you are a homophobe unfamiliar with metropolitan areas or are travelling with young children who are kept sheltered, this might be a problem for you. As for the hotel itself- it is a large hotel and there isn't a whole lot of personal service. The area overall is a little noisy, after all, you are downtown in a big city with a lot of police presence. There is adequate space in the room and bathroom - in fact, by European standards, the place is huge! The views are nice - better from the upper floors, of course. The room decor is hideous and the pool is tiny - but if you're rarely in your room or swim, who cares? Probably my only complaint is the the beds are the hardest I've slept on in my life and the pillows are like sacks of old heavy clothes. If we choose not to stay there again, that will be the only reason why. (Oh, and my daughter Shelby just reminded me that the toilet got clogged and there wasn't enough shampoo.) Taxis are not nearly as cost-prohibitive as in other cites so even if you don't choose to take the metro (it does get ridiculously crowded), it's still a great base camp. We travelled with a 4, 7, and an 11 year old and you can ride in a special section on the metro with kids. Definitely visit the Zocalo, Chapultepec Park (especially the palace and museum of Anthropology), the Basilica of Guadalupe and Xochimilco. And take a day trip to the pyramids. Off the beaten path is the Leon Trotsky house that he lived and was murdered in after his exile from Russia and the Freida Kahlo and Diego Rivera home - very educational and worthwhile. But even 6 days was not enough to see enough of this amazing city - we'll be back. All in all, this hotel was a good value and we had a great time in Mexico City. But if you're a traveller who needs more plush accomodations and hangs out in your hotel, you might want to spend a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Heatless Desk Clerks”
Reviews.Author: smithlaser1
Reviews.Content: I just returned with my family and another family - friends of ours who stayed in the room next door. We all woke up yesterday morning and were covered in mosquito bites! My family was not affected as much as our friends were - one of their sons had 45 bites on his head and face alone! The rest of the family had literally dozens of bites all over their bodies and were unable to sleep all night. When they went to the front desk to show them their condition and to request a different room, the desk clerk simply told them that all the rooms have a mosquito problem and she would send someone to take care of it. After a housekeeper showed up and sprayed bug spray in the room, they thought the problem was resolved. After another night of being eaten by the mosquitos, we all checked out this morning. When my friend asked for some sort of discount due to their lack of sleep both nights and the welts all over their bodies, the clerk (the same lady as the night before) just said "No". There was not even an apology to these toddlers who had to suffer with all these bug bites. Immediately when I got home I called Best Western's 800 Customer Service number and spoke to an equally rude service agent who basically told me that there was nothing she could do either. I have a trip scheduled for later this week at a different Best Western, but I am going to cancel because chains that do not care about what happens to their customers do not deserve my business.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: meauxb
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with a tour group so I really didn't have a choice in picking this hotel, but I really liked it. My room was on the 15th floor and I had a fabulous view. The room was very spacious, very clean, and very modern. My stay was for 4 nights. I ate breakfast there every day and the breakfast buffet was very good. I also ate dinner in the restaurant 3 of the 4 nights and it was also very good. The rooftop bar is very nice and the bartender made an excellent margarita. There is 24 hour complimentary coffee in the rooftop bar. The front desk and restaurant personnel were all very friendly and helpful. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, good for first trip to Mexico City”
Reviews.Author: aussietraveller
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent booked this hotel for us so we didn't know what to expect. This is a standard 3-4 star hotel, and I mean standard. We had a standard room, which we found clean and comfortable. There was a fridge, mini bar, safe in the room. The location of this hotel is great. It is in the centre of zona rosa with lots of eating places nearby. We used the subway to get around in the daytime, and the nearest stop is 2 mins walk from the hotel. We didn't eat in the restaurant as it was expensive, there are plenty of places nearby for breakfast/lunch and dinner. If you are just after a comfortable, clean, safe place to stay in Mexico City this is the place. Be aware of the travel agency based in this hotel. We were charged twice for a tour on our credit card (and this is yet to be resolved).

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not chic”
Reviews.Author: Ditagirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Royal last week, having flown in from London via Miami. We finally arrived and the staff at reception weren't terribly interested in helping us, and after a 15 hour trip all we wanted to do was get to our room. When we finally got to our room it was pretty grim. On my double bed I only had one pillow case, and the other pillow was uncovered and covered in dubious stains, as was one of the sheets. Eugh. The bathroom was grotty and needed a thorough clean. The hotel may be cheap but they could at least give you a clean room. I hardly slept due to the highway outside and the police sirens up and down the street. Breakfast the next day was interesting - it made my old school food like like Michelin star quality food. Tasteless eggs, rock solid 'pancakes' and bitter coffee. We were due to stay another night there - we cancelled and stayed at the Hotel Emporio, which was more expensive but so much better.

Reviews.Title: “If you must... but skip the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jwadem
Reviews.Content: If you choose to stay here, take advantage of the acceptable services and facilities, but skip the hotel breakfast- I recommend instead walking a block to La Casa de La Enchilada on Liverpool to pay 50% of the price for double the quality.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: TomWilks
Reviews.Content: The hotel has clean, comfortable rooms and a beautiful restaurant and lobby. Unfortunately it is on the corner of a massive highway and surrounded by dilapidated buildings- however this is what a lot of central Mexico City looks like. The restaurant staff were friendly and wonderful and the food was tasty and was of mostly American cuisine. The reception staff were a different story. Unfriendly, unwilling to help and at times refusing to order a radio taxi or tell us whether places were safe to visit or not! Beware- one of the leading ladies at reception, Maria, was particularly rude and we ended up going to the Sheraton to use their concierge to get around Mexico City!

Reviews.Title: “Good but expensive”
Reviews.Author: newtowndirk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right in the middle of the zona rosa in Mexico City. The hotel deserves the 4* rating, nevertheless, compared to other hotels around the world it seems to be rater expensive. The rooms are above average, they are huge and the hotel offers free Wi-Fi or free broadband acces to the internet in every room. The breakfast buffet has been average, while the guys at the reception have been very helpful and friendly. There is also a very small pool at the upper floor. From my point of view, this is a solid option for a business traveler, if you are on vacation or if you look for a more unique hotel, look for other options.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mexicantraveler101
Reviews.Content: I just got back from spending a week in mexico. I stayed 2 days in mexico city before I went home. The hotel is very tell even though the elevater goes to 17. The hotel still goes to about 20 stories or more. I can't wait until I go on my month vacation. Next year. I would definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great oasis”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Hotel Royak in the Zona Rosa of Mexico City is a near perfect experience. As a business traveller the HR is excellent quality for price, friendly, delightful stay with spacious comfortable rooms, excellent meals with two restaurants (one with a breakfast buffet). For the cigar smokers, there is a cigar bar attached with high quality low price Royal brand cigars. Free internet (either wireless or wired, depending on the room). An excellent indoor-outdoor penthouse bar and even a gym and pool. What is not to love. A secure ATM about fifty feet down the block. Walk outside and you immediately understand the oasis concept. Zona Rosa, at one time a great tourist district has become everything that you may not want, especially as a solo traveller. Sleezy harassment every step of evey block. Out on the street after 6:00 PM is a major challenge. Dive for one of the secure taxis and you are fine, but you better make sure it is secure. One fatiques of this very quickly. If you plan to come to Mexico City for business and you have to stay in the Zona Rosa area, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the other things!”
Reviews.Author: Mexiwi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Royal hotel as a group of 8 accomadating 4 rooms (3 doubles and 2 singles). The hotel was clean and very tidy, and the hotel staff were very nice and helpful. This hotel is situated only 2 minutes walk from the famous silver markets of the Zona Rosa. There is a huge amount of toursit security in the Zona Rosa and as a group felt very safe walking the streets at night. We were all enjoying our stay except for one HUGE sore point which ruined our experience of Mexico city. The sore point was a tour company (VIAJES PREMIER,S.A.) operating in the lobby of the hotel, I would suggest you ensure you get a receipt for what you pay for and make sure what is included is contained on the receipt and not just the total you have paided or you may find yourself going on one of those infamous Mexican tours. The guide picked us up in a van, did a couple of circles of the same block of buildings, then took us to a Mariachi restaurant with an all inclusive deal. Then when we wanted to leave the restaurant, the staff handed us a bill for the night out. No way out of it we had to pay, and as the hotel is not responsible we left with somewhat lighter wallets and a promise to never return to this hotel due to this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, call a chiropractor”
Reviews.Author: Wandering_Guy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from spending one week in Mexico City; the first three nights at the Royal Zona Rosa. If you are planning to get around Mexico City using the Metro (highly recommended) then the Royal Zona Rosa is an excellent location, right across the street from the Insurgentes Metro station. It's also centrally located within easy walking distance all of the shops and restaurants of the Zona Rosa area. The room was clean and the water was hot with excellent pressure (not always the case in Mexico as a quick check of many reviews on this site will atest). The shower curtain, however, was installed so that it was impossible for water not to flood the bathroom floor. Luckily, there was a drain in the middle of the floor, but it still meant standing in some water until housekeeping did their thing. A word of caution: the beds are hard as rocks. The room was equipped with two queen-sized beds, and both were equally uncomfortable. I'm not sure that the floor wouldn't have been softer. After three nights, we moved to the Hotel Maria Cristina, where the beds were much more comfortable. All-in-all, a good hotel, though if you're willing to walk a few blocks more to get to the Metro and shops, I think there are better values to be had in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very happy with everything at the Zona Rosa!”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkDave
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Royal Zona Rosa for 5 nights. Rooms were very clean, great water pressure/hot water, very clean. Super location! My friend and I could walk to Chepultapec Park, restaurants in the Zona Rosa, and the hip neighborhood of Condesa on the other side of the Insurgentes metro stop (check out all the restaurants on Amsterdam and surrounding streets!). We used the pool (heated, on the roof), room service (lovely), the business office (to burn a photo CD since my memory card ran out). Everyone there was muy simpatic! Guadalupe, our reservationist, was very helpful with airport info and was totally cool when I called her the next day to cancel MY booking in exchange for the one my friend found on the net for a lower rate (it was US$30 cheaper than their average rate). I encourage everyone to give this hotel a try. It caters well to both the business and leisure traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 1 night in Jan 2006 and it was really good. The room was really spacious and they had already made up the extra fold out bed for us (3 singles staying in a double room) before we arrived. Everything was better than expected including the breakfast buffet which had a wide variety of things. The hotel recommended a taxi driver who spoke english to take us to the sun and moon pyramids and it was awesome! There is a small pool and garden area on the top story of the building which would be nice to relax in, but is quite small. Overall we were really impressed with this hotel and would recommend it for any stay in Mexico City!

Reviews.Title: “Clueless staff, corporate rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As soon as we arrived there were problems with the staff here, who were unfriendly, unhelpful and had no knowledge of our booking. After about an hour, in which they had not even invited us to sit in the lobby, they finally gave us a room, but at a higher rate. It had a terrible view of other rooms and was decorated in a completely uninspired style. The television did not work. Though the small roof top pool is nice, I would not recommend this hotel at all. It's a five-star hotel and you expect a better standard of service than what we were given.

Reviews.Title: “A Great find!”
Reviews.Author: elvisisdead
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to spend an extra day in D.F. and picked this hotel on a whim, because of the location. The staff was one of the most accomodating I have ever come across! The hotel is in the heart of the Zona Rosa district, and steps from the Metro (we found the Metro much more efficient than driving in taxis, and is only 2 pesos...) Easy access to the Archaelogical Museum and Zocalo. The whole hotel is up-to-date and clean. Our room was large, and well decorated. The staff went out of their way to be helpful, and even managed to retrieve a bag that we left in a taxi! I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel... It's a steal for the price...

HotelInfo.Name: Royal Zona Rosa Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Amberes 78 - Zona Rosa | Colonia Juárez, Mexico City 06600, Mexico
